title: Libya's Crisis and War
content:
Libya, a mid-northern African nation, situated on the coasts of the Mediterranean, bordering Egypt, Algeria, Sudan, Chad and Niger, and known for being rich in oil, has been starring in its potential annihilation ever since the attempted successful murder of its 69-year-old leader Muammar Gaddafi. The annihilation actions and events were described by the former U.S. President Barack Obama as “the worst mistake” of his presidency.

In the Thursday dawn of October twentieth, Muammar Gaddafi in a coat of his bodyguards, and his head of—now unsubstantial—army made their steps forward to the west after a two-month siege of the Libyan coastal city Sirte (7 on the map). Allegedly, France proclaimed strafing Libyan military vehicles near Sirte, without being sure-footed of the success of Gaddafi’s assassination. Gaddafi, still coated in his henchmen, escaped the attack into two drainage pipes on the main road. In their escape, fighters of the government patrol started firing; in turn, Gaddafi got heavily wounded in the head by one of his own men’s gunshot before being captured. Governors were not sure of the accurate death time; however, it is estimated to be at the noon of the same day.

Prior to Gaddafi’s death, the first civil war—habitually referred to as 17 February Revolution—broke out between the Libyan Armed Force, and the National Transitional Council (alongside the NATO members) after preceding protests and minor clashes to overthrow Gaddafi’s tyrant government. Originally, the population rage rose focused on local national affairs; over the time, it became further concerned with the deposing of Gaddafi’s regime that turned into mutual firing between the NATO and the Libyan Armed Force.

During the military firing on the population, the UN Security Control froze all assets of Ghaddafi, thereby restricting his travels and criminalizing his actions, and later on, attacking his powers and enforcing no-fly areas over the nation. Libyan territories authority was, by force, taken back and forth between the two parties. In the aftermath of Gaddafi’s death, the National Transition Council was considered the Libyan contemporary leading power after their recognition from the UN, declaring the end of the war.

The incidents of the Libyan regicide of Muammar Gaddafi brought undesirable bifurcation to the national population of Libya, the proliferation of weapons, lawlessness, and wide massacres. The Libyan people’s desire for a democratically endorsed nation died out in the increasing vaccines of crimes, and the inevitable military craves for the Libyan oil. Most of the nation became under the sovereignty of Tobruk-led government (Tobruk, 12 on the map) powered by the House of Representatives and the Libyan National Army. Having some north- and- southwestern land under the control of the Government of National Accord, a land in the north overtaken by the Islamic State of Iraq and Syria, and distinct, scattered areas under the power of local forces. In addition, a group of armed extremists known as the Shoura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries emblazoned its name in the conflicts after repeated attacks on Libyan military bases.

Ongoing conflicts ameliorated in 2014 after an unsuccessful military coup established by the Libyan Republican Alliance into a second civil war. The war was waged between the Libyan House of Representatives, Government of National Accord, National Salvation Government, The Shoura Council, and ISIS, with both Egypt and the UAE involved.

Breaking out in Friday sixteenth, 2014, the battle of Benghazi took place, in which field marshal Khalifa Haftar, head of the Libyan National Army attacked Islamist paramilitaries in Benghazi (8 on the map), with the intention of their total eradication. The reciprocal ammunition discharge (between the Shoura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries and ISIS against the Libyan Armed Forced) killed and injured hundreds of extremist, army force, and innocent individuals.

In August of the same year, the two parties relapsed the missiles shooting after an attempt from the Shoura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries (SCBR) to take over the Benina Airport. Nonetheless, the continuous attempts to fulfill the offense failed and leading back into the second Battle of Benghazi.

Unlike the first quarrel, the second Battle of Benghazi continued for 3 years, starting in October 2014 between SCBR (partnering with Libya Shield and Libya Revolutionaries Operations Room), ISIS, and the Libyan Armed Force. The affairs of the battle exploited the action of the Benina Airport offense to deploy the Libyan National Army deep into the den of Benghazi “terrorists”, according to Haftar. Haftar moved his forces into Benghazi in October 2014, with the support of Benghazi residents dismantling Islamist checkpoints.

LNA or Libyan National Army proclaimed their authority over 90% of the city by December of the same year. Two months later, the LNA got involved in heavy clashes and almost 700 death. The firing continued at uneven paces between the aforementioned parties until the LNA succeeded in purging out the terrorists of Benghazi. Few battles continued to exist in 2018, having the Battle of Sabha as the last one so far. The war remains active until now, enforcing disorder, broad catastrophes, and a death toll of almost 4,000 human being.
side:
* picture by Setav

Libya is a mediterranean country located to the west of Egypt and south of Italy. It also happens to have been one of the wealthiest and most influential up until it was predominated by terroist groups and devoured in civil war. This essays gives an overview of the death of former president Al-Gaddafi and the consequences on his death on the country.

title: In Response to SAT Practice Test #8 Essay
content:
Prompt: Write an essay in which you explain how Bobby Braun builds an argument to persuade his audience that the US government must continue to invest in NASA.
In your essay, analyze how Braun uses one or more of the features listed in the instructions to the left (or features of your own choice) to strengthen the logic and persuasiveness of his argument. Be sure that your analysis focuses on the most relevant features of the passage.>br>Your essay should not explain whether you agree with Braun’s claims, but rather explain how Braun builds an argument to persuade his audience.

The idea that the US government must continue to invest in NASA is indispensably entrenched in American economics, but its cardinal causes are often overlooked, In "Space Technology: A Critical Investment for Our Nation's Future," Bobby Braun synthesizes a dissertation that America should pursue funding and expansion opportunities for NASA to accomplish its intended missions. Although many detractors believe that NASA has already emblazoned itself as the bellwether of space exploration and is no need for continuous investments at this point, arguments put forth in this article dismiss such romantic critics as excessively dogmatic in their provincial ideology. In doing so, Braun employs a diverse set of supporting evidence including examples, word choice, and juxtaposition.

Braun deft use of supporting examples begins in paragraph 2 as he mentions a variety of "cutting-edge technology" that includes "the Apollo mission," "the space shuttle," "the International Space Station," and others. In implementing these examples into his editorial, Braun is capable of instilling the idea that NASA has provided various infamous milestones in the past, which he later contrasts with "NASA's technology base is largely depleted" in paragraph 3. That way, Braun is capable of not only laying down an introduction that grips the reader into comprehending the wide impact of NASA but also allows his contention to trail down a path that eventually lead the reader into an understanding of why funding is important for a continuous success for NASA and America's competitive economy. Later, in paragraph 4, Braun shows another set of examples as he begins to detail NASA's "exciting new chapter in human space exploration." This comes in direct juxtaposition with the earlier examples to show that NASA's future is distinctively similar to its past. Readers, especially skeptic detractors, are caught in the idea that funding space would no longer be profitable or that new innovations in space exploration are not possible. These examples that include "full use of the International Space Station," "development of a crew vehicle," and more in the same sentence ground the author's argument in reality that even the most doubtful readers would not be able to dismiss the need for monetary governmental support for NASA.

Just as persuasive as Braun's use of supporting examples is his choice of words. His meticulous diction of intense words is vividly displayed in words such as "strong" (paragraph 1 in description of Aerospace's fundamental importance to American trade balance), "cutting-edge" (paragraph 2 in narration of various examples of past achievements of NASA, and "chronic" (paragraph 3 in stating dangers faced by modern-day NASA." The first two words evoke an imagery of strength and power that the reader relates to NASA, creating an overall good connotation to make the author's argument easier to accept, while the third serves the purpose of using this image and contrasting it with weaknesses that NASA might suffer. Ultimately, the use of the three words allow the author to make the reader relate to NASA, not as a national agency, but as a person who can be "strong" and suffer weakness due to "chronic" actions to further push their support of the importance of NASA's investment for American trade. Braun also employs another set of words: "pioneering spirit," "embodied" (paragraph 3 in contrasting past NASA with modern-day NASA), and "mature" (paragraph 5). The use of words typically employed in description of human person greatly adds to Braun's persuasive power as he is not implying that NASA could be seen as a human being (like in earlier examples of word choice) but directly stating it. Readers are generally more capable of identifying with another human being over a non-living national cluster which makes Braun's argument change from objective economic needs of the nation to an exploitation of human empathy.

Lastly, Braun bolsters his argument with juxtaposition. He mentions that "Nearly 50 years ago, a young president gave NASA a grand challenge—one chose...for its audacity," and he later follow, "NASA can do the same today." The complex nature of the author's juxtaposition in which he creates a hypothetical situation to compare with a state of glamour that NASA lived in the past lays the ground for the reader to imagine what Braun has in mind and the reasons behind his support for the NASA's funding. The reader would affirm that NASA's leadership is not "granted," and that further work and national fund is needed to keep the legacy going. "This is the task for which this agency is built... America expects no less," he concludes his juxtaposition, stressing that such a probable situation is the sole purpose of the agency, further eliciting the image in the reader's mind.

In summary, author Bobby Braun—using supporting examples, word choice, and juxtaposition—makes the case that the US government should dedicate further spending portions of its investments for NASA. It is these persuasive elements that not only informs the reader about a situation but spurs the reader into making it a reality.

Khan Academy SAT Essay Grading Tool gives this essay 21/24 7/7/7.

<p class="c7"><span class="c14 c12 c19">EXECUTIVE SUMMARY:</span></p>
<p class="c7 c8"><span class="c10 c13">Tarina Webstore and Ideation (short: Tarina) </span><span class="c10">is a social enterprise that provides an online platform (e-commerce) for gifted ladies to showcase their high-quality handcrafted products. Unlike other platforms on the market, Tarina</span>
    <span class="c10 c13"> </span><span class="c10">allocates the needed resources and exposure to support handmade products while providing its customers with access to high-quality products from well-established brands and startup hand-makers on the same platform. Ideally, Tarina pledges a notable portion of its margin profits for sufferers of skin burns, leprosy, and other causes that align with its core values.</span></p>
<p class="c7"><span class="c14 c12 c19">MISSION:</span></p>
<p class="c7 c8"><span class="c2">Nurturing handcraft talents as a part of a cycle that transforms their gifts into products, products into money, and money into payback for our community to support more talents into being productive.</span></p>
<p class="c7"><span class="c14 c12 c19">VISION:</span></p>
<p class="c7 c8"><span class="c2">To gather those who can shape a piece of art to pave a road where beauty stands for those who need it across the globe.</span></p>
<p class="c7"><span class="c14 c12 c19">THE PROBLEM:</span></p>
<p class="c7 c8"><span class="c10">Handmade products and accessories have grown in popularity in Egypt in recent years, thanks to social media and its aesthetic features. According to </span><span class="c10 c13">The Chamber of Handicrafts</span><span class="c10">, it reached a peak of shares of $210m in the domestic market alone in 2017 (Deyaa’ 2019)</span>
    <sup class="c10 c16"><a href="#ftnt1" id="ftnt_ref1">[1]</a></sup><span class="c10">. Constituting a notable share of the Egyptian market, handicrafts are mostly considered a secondary source of income, currently dominated by solo startup handcrafters, 80% of which are women. (Dollar 2019)</span>
    <sup class="c10 c16"><a href="#ftnt2" id="ftnt_ref2">[2]</a></sup>
</p>
<p class="c7 c8"><span class="c2">Additionally, most solo craftswomen establish their businesses for supplementary income and have to do the heavy lifting of building a brand and a customer base from scratch, usually doing so through Facebook Marketplace or exhibitions. These businesses usually are limited by their size and outreach as micro- and small- enterprises (MSEs) and lack of creativity due to the extreme demands of the market and brand crafting.</span></p>
<p class="c7 c8"><span class="c10">These demands are established differently across platforms, whether online or in-person. To begin with, audience targeting on online platforms is challenging, requiring expertise from novice business-owners. Facebook, the most common online marketplace platform, hinders the growth of small businesses as a result of its constantly changing set of algorithms used to display content to its users (Gingerich 2019)</span>
    <sup class="c10 c16"><a href="#ftnt3" id="ftnt_ref3">[3]</a></sup><span class="c10"> that inhibits businesses from reaching their already established fanbase (Carter 2020)</span><sup class="c10 c16"><a href="#ftnt4" id="ftnt_ref4">[4]</a></sup>
    <span class="c10"> by obscuring businesses’ advertisements and even declining their ads altogether (Calukovic 2019)</span>
    <sup class="c10 c16"><a href="#ftnt5" id="ftnt_ref5">[5]</a></sup><span class="c10">. Second, in-person endeavors, including exhibitions and solo small markets, are often available in limited amounts and distributed sparsely over the year. Regular solo small markets (e.g. airport markets) are usually costly to operate and often replaced by cheaper, low-quality imported products, while regular exhibitions are not aplenty.  Lastly, craftswomen end up with no time to pursue the creativity of their products, the pillar of handicrafts’ popularity, due to the effort-consuming demands of building their brand through online and in-person endeavors, thus sabotaging their own businesses. </span></p>
<p class="c7 c8"><span class="c10">Finally, considering the way the market exposes newcomers to competition in price and outreach beyond the size of their businesses, previous researches have shown that solo market participation, and even means of exportation, is not promising to support craftswomen of Egypt. (Hassanin 2008)</span>
    <sup class="c10 c16"><a href="#ftnt6" id="ftnt_ref6">[6]</a></sup><span class="c10"> This comes in accordance with the findings of Professor Rosalinda Ofreneo in 2005 on how microfinance is not suitable for handcrafted products as means of alleviating poverty, especially when considering governmental regulations. (Ofreneo 2005)</span>
    <sup class="c10 c16"><a href="#ftnt7" id="ftnt_ref7">[7]</a></sup><span class="c2"> </span></p>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_9-0 start" start="1">
    <li class="c5 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Platform-Related Problems</span></li>
</ol>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_9-1 start" start="1">
    <li class="c6 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Online Platform: Facebook Pages and Facebook Marketplace</span></li>
</ol>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_9-2 start" start="1">
    <li class="c7 c20 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Demands substantial familiarity with technology and the internet and a professional expertise in online marketing</span></li>
    <li class="c7 c20 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Hinders reach to already established audience per its algorithms </span></li>
    <li class="c7 c20 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Financially demanding for micro- and small-business by way of advertisements</span></li>
    <li class="c7 c20 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Impedes advertisements through privacy regulations</span></li>
</ol>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_9-1" start="2">
    <li class="c6 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Online Platform: Non-Social Media Marketplaces (e.g. Souq.com, Jumia)</span></li>
</ol>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_9-2 start" start="1">
    <li class="c7 c20 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Does not allocate resources or marketing for handcrafting</span></li>
    <li class="c7 c20 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Does not showcase handmade products or list them as an official category</span></li>
</ol>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_9-1" start="3">
    <li class="c6 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">In-person Platforms</span></li>
</ol>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_8-0 start" start="1">
    <li class="c7 c20 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Limited in opportunities and outreach</span></li>
    <li class="c7 c20 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Only promotes handicrafts to people who are interested in handicrafts (no market expansion)</span></li>
    <li class="c7 c20 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Demands a portion of working time dedicated to attending in-person exhibitions</span></li>
</ol>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_9-0" start="2">
    <li class="c5 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Effects of Natural Circumstances</span></li>
</ol>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_9-1 start" start="1">
    <li class="c6 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">COVID-19 and other natural circumstances impede the potential of using in-person platforms or delivering products through online platforms, deeming most of client-customer means of communication inaccessible</span></li>
</ol>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_9-0" start="3">
    <li class="c5 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Competition</span></li>
</ol>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_9-1 start" start="1">
    <li class="c6 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Most craftswomen work individually or in small groups, often targeting the same audience without market expansion, and thus, populating a small portion of the market with supply beyond the demand</span></li>
</ol>
<p class="c7"><span class="c12">KEY ACTIVITIES:</span></p>
<p class="c7 c8"><span class="c10">Parallel to similar global endeavors (such as </span><span class="c10 c13">Etsy</span><span class="c2">) and aligned with the Egyptian plans to foster and institutionalize e-commerce for the marketing of female crafts, Tarina provides an e-commerce platform dedicated to supporting handmade products. In doing so, Tarina takes responsibility for branding, marketing, market expansion, outreach, client-customer relationships, and risks—allowing craftswomen to focus entirely on mastering their craft, thus securing a stable source of income.</span></p>
<p class="c7 c8"><span class="c2">For craftswomen, Tarina provides them with an intuitive user experience (UX) to list their items after having completed quality control tests and agreed to Tarina terms and conditions. TOS of Tarina ensures that Tarina is capable of creating a brand associated with luxury, quality, cost-friendliness, social-contribution, and aesthetics. These elements persist as key factors in Tarina’s marketing and client-customer relationship of trust and evident customer satisfaction.</span></p>
<p class="c7 c8"><span class="c2">On the customer level, Tarina provides an inclusive marketplace, associated with Tarina’s brand primarily and other well-established brands, with high quality products and services that include but not limited to handmade products, skincare products, hair care products, accessories, bridal products, celebratory services, and more.</span></p>
<p class="c7 c8"><span class="c2">Tarina operates using a budget dedicated to management, marketing, and capital expenditures. A portion of Tarina’s budget is acquired through product sales on the e-commerce platform in the form of compulsory commissions. However, the main revenue streams for Tarina are investments, donations, fundraising, and on-site advertising to govern the above-mentioned costs.</span></p>
<p class="c7 c18"><span class="c2"></span></p>
<p class="c7"><span class="c14 c12 c19">UNIQUE VALUE PROPOSITION: </span></p>
<p class="c7 c8"><span class="c2">Unlike any other platform, Tarina dedicates its resources to establishing the presence of talented craftswomen in the industry via means of a single centralized platform that connects businesses with potential customers, thus maximizing crafts creativity, client outreach, and customer satisfaction. </span></p>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_12-0 start" start="1">
    <li class="c5 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Primary dedication for handmades</span></li>
</ol>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_12-1 start" start="1">
    <li class="c6 li-bullet-0"><span class="c10">Branding: handmade products can opt-in to be associated with </span><span class="c10 c13">Tarina</span><span class="c2">, alleviating the need to establish brand identity for solo endeavors,</span></li>
    <li class="c6 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Marketing: Tarina operates through a centralized e-commerce platform “Tarina Webstore,” under one management, associating itself with one maintained brand, and undertaking centralized marketing plan, which targets people who are potentially interested in handmade products.</span></li>
    <li class="c6 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Market Expansion: Tarina exploits the intersection between the expansive market of female products (skin-care products, etc…) and people interested in purchasing handmade products to expand the market and outreach of Tarina’s product partners. </span></li>
    <li class="c6 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Outreach: unlike competitive marketplaces, Tarina uses special algorithms to ensure that the platform provides a secure stable source of income and an equal opportunity for all craftswomen. </span></li>
    <li class="c6 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Risk Mitigation: Tarina ensures that all women receive the needed resources and means of connections with their clients even during times of crisis.</span></li>
</ol>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_12-0" start="2">
    <li class="c5 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Fostering of Talents</span></li>
</ol>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_12-1 start" start="1">
    <li class="c6 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Photography: Tarina allocates resources to assist craftswomen display their products professionally. This includes but is not limited to direction assistance, photography spaces, and photography gadgets (lighting gadgets, whiteboxes)</span></li>
    <li class="c6 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Education: as Tarina establishes its brand, a portion of the enterprise budget is dedicated to provide craft making educational opportunities for talented women.</span></li>
</ol>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_12-0" start="3">
    <li class="c5 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Flexible Commissions</span></li>
</ol>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_12-1 start" start="1">
    <li class="c6 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Handmakers: while commission is compulsory (as per financial needs of the platform), startup handmakers get to choose the amount they pledge in commission for Tarina. More experienced handmakers might be subject to pre-set commissions as long as Tarina believes it does not hinder the creative potential of the handmaker.</span></li>
    <li class="c6 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Partners: all partners are subject to pre-set commissions; however, the amount is determined by Tarina’s evaluation of the brands’ potentials</span></li>
</ol>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_12-0" start="4">
    <li class="c5 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Offering Celebratory Services</span></li>
</ol>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_12-1 start" start="1">
    <li class="c6 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Unlike other platforms, Tarina provides bridal services, among others, as part of its market expansion and inclusiveness.</span></li>
</ol>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_12-0" start="5">
    <li class="c5 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Product Administration</span></li>
</ol>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_12-1 start" start="1">
    <li class="c6 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Quality Control: All products listed on Tarina Webstore are subject to general Tarina TOS, including quality control, which ensures that all products are suitable for their intended uses.</span></li>
    <li class="c6 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Product Customization: Tarina provides customization on selected handmade products by default, while providing client-customer communication for other optional customizations.</span></li>
</ol>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_12-0" start="6">
    <li class="c5 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Philanthropic Applications</span></li>
</ol>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_12-1 start" start="1">
    <li class="c6 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Tarina pledges 5% of its margin profits for sufferers of skin burns and leprosy through charity organizations, such as Misr El Kheir.</span></li>
</ol>
<p class="c7 c18"><span class="c14 c12 c19"></span></p>
<p class="c7"><span class="c14 c12 c19">CUSTOMER SEGMENTS:</span></p>
<p class="c7 c8"><span class="c10">One of Tarina’s revenue streams comes from sales commissions. Since Tarina does not produce any products itself, the main customers for Tarina are </span><span class="c10 c13">brand partners</span>
    <span class="c10">, </span><span class="c10 c13">handmakers</span><span class="c10">, and </span><span class="c10 c13">consumers</span><span class="c2">.</span></p>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_13-0 start" start="1">
    <li class="c5 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Brand Partnerships: Tarina partners with well-established brands to sustain its market expansion endeavors and secure a revenue stream. Targeted partners are characterized by the following:</span></li>
</ol>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_13-1 start" start="1">
    <li class="c6 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Commission: most Tarina partners agree to give up to 50% of their margin profits on the platform to Tarina.</span></li>
    <li class="c6 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Targeted : target market of brand partners must align with the target market of Tarina.</span></li>
</ol>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_13-0" start="2">
    <li class="c5 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Handmakers: while Tarina aims to receive as little commission as possible from handmakers, the commissions secure a portion of Tarina’s budget. Tarina targets solo (or limited team) female handmakers who:</span></li>
</ol>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_13-1 start" start="1">
    <li class="c6 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">have little exposure (social media exposure < 5,000 likes)</span></li>
    <li class="c6 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">provide high-quality handmade products that align with Tarina’s target market</span></li>
</ol>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_13-0" start="3">
    <li class="c5 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Consumers constitute Tarina’s target market. Our target consumers are:</span></li>
</ol>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_13-1 start" start="1">
    <li class="c6 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Females: since most products offered on Tarina Webstore are ones of interest of a primarily female market.</span></li>
    <li class="c6 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Aged 16 through 60: since products offered on Tarina Webstore appeal to a large portion of the female market despite their age. Tarina offers accessories (16+), skincare and hair care products (18+), bridal services and cakes (21–30), home decor (21+), baby care products (23–40), and anti-aging products (35–60).</span></li>
    <li class="c6 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Of above-average socioeconomic status: since this is the socioeconomic layer which bears interest and are capable of affording most of the products offered.</span></li>
</ol>
<p class="c7 c8"><span class="c10">However, Tarina establishes its main revenue streams from sponsorships, fundraising campaigns, and on-site advertisements. Sponsors are targeted to be companies with core values that align with that of Tarina and fundraising campaigns target the same main target market. Similarly, on-site advertisement targets advertisers who are interested in Tarina’s target market; this includes advertisers of female and baby products, female-targeted social media pages, surveys, and more.</span></p>
<p class="c7"><span class="c14 c12 c19">CUSTOMER RELATIONSHIP:</span></p>
<p class="c7 c8"><span class="c2">Tarina stands as a brand built on trust and evident customer satisfaction. Consequently, Tarina has established or is establishing the following:</span></p>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_16-0 start" start="1">
    <li class="c5 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Brand Identity: </span></li>
</ol>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_5-0 start" start="1">
    <li class="c6 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Tarina builds a brand that is known for three key takeaways: luxurious HQ products, transparency, and loyalty. The brand identity is defined by colors that symbolize luxury, while the products themselves are associated with high quality as a result of quality control procedures. </span></li>
</ol>
<p class="c7 c27"><span class="c2">II.        Communication channels:</span></p>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_16-1 start" start="1">
    <li class="c6 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Tarina–handmaker communication ensures that handmakers are aware of the latest regulations and provide the needed information and quality while allowing Tarina to provide craftswomen with the needed resources.</span></li>
    <li class="c6 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Tarina–consumer communications are established through Tarina’s website chatbot, email service, social media messaging, live social media chats, and priority contact for Patreon subscribers. This ensures that consumers are satisfied with their products, aware of Tarina’s services, and perceive the brand as expected.</span></li>
</ol>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_16-0" start="2">
    <li class="c5 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Product Customization:</span></li>
</ol>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_2-0 start" start="1">
    <li class="c6 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2"> Since Tarina showcases handmade products, handmakers can opt-in to offer pre-determined customization or on-demand customization. Tarina stands as an intermediary between consumers and handmakers to satisfy consumers with their needed products.</span></li>
</ol>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_16-0" start="3">
    <li class="c5 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Transparency: </span></li>
</ol>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_7-0 start" start="1">
    <li class="c6 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">For all customers, including brand partners, handmakers, and consumers, Tarina remains transparent in its endeavor. All partners, prices, sources of income, team members, and contact information of Tarina are publicly available and listed through Tarina Webstore website.</span></li>
</ol>
<p class="c7"><span class="c10">Current communication channels represent a fraction of the overall cost of operation.</span></p>
<p class="c7"><span class="c14 c12 c19">CHANNELS:</span></p>
<p class="c7 c8"><span class="c2">Tarina is dedicated to maintaining its customer relationships, integrating itself with its customers. Tarina’s customer channel phases are as follows:</span></p>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_10-0 start" start="1">
    <li class="c5 li-bullet-0"><span class="c10">Awareness: Tarina is currently accessible through social media (Facebook, Instagram, Patreon), its e-commerce website </span><span class="c10 c13">Tarina Webstore</span>
        <span class="c10">, and Tarina email. Otherwise, Tarina expands its outreach through a dedicated marketing partnership established with </span><span class="c10 c13">Digitawires</span><span class="c2"> (social media agency) and a community management department that deal with social accelerators, competitions, and events. Other community outreach activities include televised appearances, advertisements, sponsorships, communication with celebrities, press releases, magazines. Tarina plans to be more mobile-friendly through an Android and an iOS app.</span></li>
    <li class="c5 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Evaluation: Tarina’s consumers are regularly reminded of the unique value proposition through social media posts and Tarina’s promo video. Customers can evaluate the delivery of the value proposition through celebrity endorsements (published on social media), testimonials (published on social media), established partnerships, and/or by testing the products themselves (refunds are offered for products that do not meet the quality control standards).</span></li>
    <li class="c5 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Purchase: all consumers can purchase directly from Tarina Webstore by creating a free account, selecting the desired products, and providing us with their information. Currently, the only transaction method offered is cash-on-delivery (COD).</span></li>
    <li class="c5 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Delivery: Tarina reinforces a set of terms and conditions for all handmakers and partners to ensure quality standards and product availability. </span></li>
    <li class="c5 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">After-Sales: Tarina keeps its relationship with its customers updated and firm. After making a purchase, consumers can contact Tarina through social media, email, or the chatbot service offered on the website. Consumers can provide ratings, inquire about their products, or demand refunds.</span></li>
</ol>
<p class="c7"><span class="c14 c12 c19">KEY RESOURCES:</span></p>
<p class="c7"><span class="c2">Tarina uses a particular set of resources to deliver on its unique value proposition.</span></p>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_17-0 start" start="1">
    <li class="c5 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Physical Resources</span></li>
</ol>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_17-1 start" start="1">
    <li class="c6 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Tarina’s products featured on Tarina Webstore, including but not limited to handmade products, skincare products, hair care products, accessories, bridal products, and celebratory services.</span></li>
    <li class="c6 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Website Server: the server is required to maintain the website active, dynamic, and secure.</span></li>
</ol>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_17-0" start="2">
    <li class="c5 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Intellectual Resources:</span></li>
</ol>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_17-1 start" start="1">
    <li class="c6 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Tarina’s Website: the website is used as a platform to connect product partners with potentially interested customers, giving all affiliated craftswomen a fair opportunity to sell their products.</span></li>
    <li class="c6 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Proprietary Knowledge: Tarina’s partnership established with Digital Wires (social media agency) provides Tarina and Tarina’s partners with expanded outreach through dedicated marketing and a community management department that deals with social accelerators, competitions, and events. </span></li>
    <li class="c6 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Customer and Client Knowledge: Tarina’s customer knowledge, targeted age group, featured products, and partners’ selection (based on intertwining interests) is granted through a centralized database that includes logs of previous customer purchases and demographics.</span></li>
    <li class="c6 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Tarina’s brand </span></li>
    <li class="c6 li-bullet-0"><span class="c2">Tarina’s Webstore UI/UX, code, and database</span></li>
</ol>
<ol class="c1 lst-kix_list_17-0" start="3">

title: Simulating Populations During Pandemics: Why and Why Not
content:
If you have ever played an open-world videogame, say Grand Theft Auto, for example, then you have already seen how capable computers in generating populations. In most of these games, non-player characters are used to simulate people in cities. It does not seem surprising, considering how most computers nowadays carry out nearly 2-4 billion calculations per second. In the same sense NPCs are used to populate videogames, computers can help simulate populations in pandemics in order to take calculated decisions (Lankoski, P and Bjork, S 2007) [1].

To give an idea of how that could be established, consider first how computer programming works: essentially, a program takes input data (for simplicity’s sake, assume everything is a number) and performs numerical manipulations based on rules defined through code. A code, similarily, is a set of precise orders that exploit tools offered by programming languages, such as controlled repetition and making decisions (Halterman, R 1995) [2].

In a pandemic, populations could be interperted a list of variables (tracked data with changing values) that traverses a coordinate system. Each variable represents an individual that abides by the SIR model, which means it is either “susceptible,” “infectious,” or “removed.” In a programming environment, it is possible to define the size of the coordinate system, the size of the population, and the rules that define the change from S->R. For instance, each variable may only infect 20% of other individuals within a defined range-of-infection. Once our program runs, it generates function S(t), susceptible people as a function of time, which can be represented graphically.

Now, a typical epidemiologist would like to introduce approaches to limit the growth of an epidemic. However, computers only deal with numbers, so it is impossible to tell a computer to “introduce face masks, ” for instance. That is why an epidemiologist has to cast real-life ideas into a numerical representation. To execute the face mask example, an epidemiologist might cut down the probability of infection to 1.5%, assuming all population abides (Magal, P. and Webb, G 2018)[3].

To translate this into a decision-making model, it is necessary to definite the function S(t) more formally to be equivalent of , where the number of susceptible individuals at any unit time is proportional to the basic reproduction number R0 (Smith, D. and Moore, L. 2004)[4]. As the epidemiologist experiments with different pandemic scenarios, this value is generated and allows for comparison between different approaches or even a concatenation of many, where a lower value means less spread and a better decision.

Nonetheless, this model is not perfect. First, it provides two challenges: defining rules that simulate real-life population dynamics and projecting approaches into numerical manipulations. This allows for vast errors in the process, and considering the sensitivity of pandemic scenarios to slight changes, it makes many epidemiological researchs purposeless. Second, an SIR model overlooks fatality, treating both “recovered” and “dead” equally, which can lead to catastrophic implications if not considered by the epidemiologist (Magal, P. and Webb, G 2018)3 .

In the end, computer science integrates with statistics to offer epidemiologists and politicians the tools to make appropriate decisions during pandemics. It is the same computation power behind your videogames that can put pandemics to halt, preventing thousands of casualties every year.

BIBLOGRAPHY

[1] Lankoski, P. and Bjork, S. “Gameplay Design Patterns for Believable Non-Player Characters,” DiGRA ‘07 4 (2007) 416

[2] Halterman R., “Fundamentals Of Programming,” Business & Educational Technologies (1995) 1-2

[3] Magal, P. and Webb, G, 'The Parameter Identification Problem For SIR Epidemic Models: Identifying Unreported Cases,’ Journal of Mathematical Biology 77:6-7 (2018) 1629-1630

[4] Smith, D. and Moore, L., "The SIR Model for Spread of Disease - The Differential Equation Model," Journal of Online Mathematics and its Applications (2004)

As politicians and government official everywhere are trying to make the right decisions to control the pandemic, computer science proves helpful in giving foresign into the effects of various protection and safety means. This essay gives an overview of how to do that, why it is helpful, and the caveats of this approach.

This essay have been recognised as one of the highest caliber of entries to Immerse Education Essay Competition 2021.
desc: As politicians and government official everywhere are trying to make the right decisions to control the pandemic, computer science proves helpful in giving foresign into the effects of various protection and safety means. This essay gives an overview of how to do that, why it is helpful, and the caveats of this approach.
